snippet: For more than two years, the Obama administration maneuvered to make a deal to free Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl the start of a larger peace process for Afghanistan.
abstract: Obama administration has for more than two and a half years maneuvered to make deal to free Sgt Bowe Bergdahl the start of larger peace process in Afghanistan; decision to go ahead with straight prisoner swap reflects how time after time, American goals in the region have been narrowed again and again.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: For more than two years, the Obama administration maneuvered to make a deal to free Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl the start of a larger peace process for Afghanistan.

headline.main: Strategy and Objectives for Gaining Soldier’s Release Shifted Over Time
headline.print_headline: Strategy and Objectives for Gaining Soldier’s Release Shifted Over Time
